intro: Pagesia acuminata subsp. typica, commonly known as the typical acuminata, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
